snippet: The case against a soccer coach charged with murdering a former girlfriend’s 12-year-old son in upstate New York raises questions of racial bias and overreaching.
abstract: Town of Potsdam, NY, remains on edge after 2011 murder of white 12-year-old Garrett Phillips, event that has raised racial tensions after black man Oral Nicholas Hillary is accused of crime; Hillary dated boy's mother Tandy Cyrus shortly before murder and some have speculated, despite lack of physical evidence, that he killed Phillips as revenge for Cyrus's breaking up with him.
lead_paragraph: The case against a soccer coach charged with murdering a former girlfriend’s 12-year-old son in upstate New York raises questions of racial bias and overreaching.

headline.main: Tensions Simmer as a Small Town Seeks Answers in a Boy’s Killing
headline.print_headline: Tensions Simmer Over Race as Town Reels From Boy’s Killing
